00062     enum IndicatorFieldEnum {
00063       // CIF0 - Legacy Fields and CIF Enables - Starts at 0*32 = 0
00064       // CIF Key                  Bit #   Description                           (CIF,Bitmask)  <==> CIF|Shift = Enum Value
00065       CIF0_RESERVED_0 = 0,   
00066       CIF1_ENABLE,           
00067       CIF2_ENABLE,           
00068       CIF3_ENABLE,           
00069       CIF0_RESERVED_4,       
00070       CIF0_RESERVED_5,       
00071       CIF0_RESERVED_6,       
00072       CIF7_ENABLE,           
00073       CONTEXT_ASOC,          
00074       GPS_ASCII,             
00075       EPHEM_REF,             
00076       REL_EPHEM,             
00077       ECEF_EPHEM,            
00078       INS_EPHEM,             
00079       GPS_EPHEM,             
00080       DATA_FORMAT,           
00081       STATE_EVENT,           
00082       DEVICE_ID,             
00083       TEMPERATURE,           
00084       TIME_CALIB,            
00085       TIME_ADJUST,           
00086       SAMPLE_RATE,           
00087       OVER_RANGE,            
00088       GAIN,                  
00089       REF_LEVEL,             
00090       IF_OFFSET,             
00091       RF_OFFSET,             
00092       RF_FREQ,               
00093       IF_FREQ,               
00094       BANDWIDTH,             
00095       REF_POINT,             
00096       CHANGE_IND,            
00097 
00098       // CIF1 - Spatial, Signal, Spectral, I/O, Control - Starts at 1*32 = 32
00099       CIF1_RESERVED_0 = 32,  
00100       BUFFER_SZ,             
00101       VER_BLD_CODE,          
00102       V49_COMPL,             
00103       HEALTH_STATUS,         
00104       DISCRETE_IO64,         
00105       DISCRETE_IO32,         
00106       INDEX_LIST,            
00107       CIF1_RESERVED_8,       
00108       SECTOR_SCN_STP,        
00109       SPECTRUM,              
00110       CIFS_ARRAY,            
00111       CIF1_RESERVED_12,      
00112       AUX_BANDWIDTH,         
00113       AUX_GAIN,              
00114       AUX_FREQUENCY,         
00115       SNR_NOISE,             
00116       ICPT_PTS_2_3,          
00117       COMPRESS_PT,           
00118       THRESHOLD,             
00119       EB_NO_BER,             
00120       CIF1_RESERVED_21,

00123       RANGE,

00129       POLARIZATION,          
00130       PHASE,                 
00131       
00132       // CIF2 - Identifiers (tags) - Starts at 2*32 = 64
00133       CIF2_RESERVED_0 = 64,  
00134       SPATIAL_REF_TYPE,      
00135       SPATIAL_SCAN_TYPE,     
00136       RF_FOOTPRINT_RANGE,    
00137       RF_FOOTPRINT,          
00138       COMM_PRIORITY_ID,      
00139       FUNCT_PRIORITY_ID,     
00140       EVENT_ID,

00142       FUNCTION_ID,           
00143       MODULATION_TYPE,       
00144       MODULATION_CLASS,

00154       INFORMATION_SOURCE,    
00155       CONTROLLER_UUID,       
00156       CONTROLLER_ID,         
00157       CONTROLLEE_UUID,       
00158       CONTROLLEE_ID,         
00159       CITED_MESSAGE_ID,      
00160       CHILDREN_SID,          
00161       PARENTS_SID,           
00162       SIBLINGS_SID,          
00163       CITED_SID,             
00164       BIND,                  
00165       
00166       // CIF3 - Temporal, Environmental - Starts at 3*32 = 96
00167       CIF3_RESERVED_0 = 96,  
00168       NETWORK_ID,            
00169       TROPOSPHERIC_STATE,    
00170       SEA_AND_SWELL_STATE,   
00171       BAROMETRIC_PRESSURE,   
00172       HUMIDITY,

00197       TIMESTAMP_SKEW,        
00198       TIMESTAMP_DETAILS,     
00199       
00200       // CIF4 - Reserved - Starts at 4*32 = 128
00201       CIF4_RESERVED_0 = 128, 
00202       /* Bits 1-31 reserved/undefined */
00203       
00204       // CIF5 - Reserved - Starts at 5*32 = 160
00205       CIF5_RESERVED_0 = 160, 
00206       /* Bits 1-31 reserved/undefined */
00207 
00208       // CIF6 - Reserved - Starts at 6*32 = 192
00209       CIF6_RESERVED_0 = 192, 
00210       /* Bits 1-31 reserved/undefined */
00211 
00212       // CIF7 - Attributes - Starts at 7*32 = 224
00213       CIF7_RESERVED_0 = 224, 
00214       CIF7_RESERVED_1,       
00215       CIF7_RESERVED_2,       
00216       CIF7_RESERVED_3,       
00217       CIF7_RESERVED_4,       
00218       CIF7_RESERVED_5,       
00219       CIF7_RESERVED_6,       
00220       CIF7_RESERVED_7,       
00221       CIF7_RESERVED_8,       
00222       CIF7_RESERVED_9,       
00223       CIF7_RESERVED_10,      
00224       CIF7_RESERVED_11,      
00225       CIF7_RESERVED_12,      
00226       CIF7_RESERVED_13,      
00227       CIF7_RESERVED_14,      
00228       CIF7_RESERVED_15,      
00229       CIF7_RESERVED_16,      
00230       CIF7_RESERVED_17,      
00231       CIF7_RESERVED_18,      
00232       BELIEF,                
00233       PROBABILITY,           
00234       THIRD_DERIVATIVE,      
00235       SECOND_DERIVATIVE,     
00236       FIRST_DERIVATIVE,      
00237       ACCURACY,              
00238       PRECISION,             
00239       MIN_VALUE,             
00240       MAX_VALUE,             
00241       STANDARD_DEVIATION,    
00242       MEDIAN_VALUE,          
00243       AVERAGE_VALUE,         
00244       CURRENT_VALUE          
00245 
00246     }; // IndicatorFieldEnum_t
00247 
00249     typedef IndicatorFieldEnum IndicatorFieldEnum_t;
00250 
00259     inline int8_t getCIFNumber (IndicatorFieldEnum_t f) {
00260       return (int8_t) ((f >> 5) & 0xFF); // divide by 32
00261     }
00262 
00271     inline int8_t getCIFBitNumber (IndicatorFieldEnum_t f) {
00272       return (int8_t) (f & 0x1F); // modulo 32
00273     }
00274 
00283     inline int32_t getCIFBitMask (IndicatorFieldEnum_t f) {
00284       return (int32_t) (0x1 << getCIFBitNumber(f)); // 1-hot bit mask for indicator field
00285     }
00286     
00297     inline IndicatorFieldEnum_t getCIFEnum(int8_t cif, int8_t bit) {
00298       return (IndicatorFieldEnum_t) (((cif & 0x7) << 5) + (bit & 0x1F));
00299     }

00487       static const int32_t CIF3_RESERVED_15_mask      = 0x00008000; // N/A (0)
00488                                                                     // For the next two, See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.2
00489       static const int32_t SHELF_LIFE_mask            = 0x00010000; // 1, 2, or 3 (same as packet tstamp based on TSI and TSF)
00490       static const int32_t AGE_mask                   = 0x00020000; // 1, 2, or 3 (same as packet tstamp based on TSI and TSF)
00491       static const int32_t CIF3_RESERVED_18_mask      = 0x00040000; // N/A (0)
00492       static const int32_t CIF3_RESERVED_19_mask      = 0x00080000; // N/A (0)
00493       static const int32_t JITTER_mask                = 0x00100000; // 2 (See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.1 for the next 8)
00494       static const int32_t DWELL_mask                 = 0x00200000; // 2
00495       static const int32_t DURATION_mask              = 0x00400000; // 2
00496       static const int32_t PERIOD_mask                = 0x00800000; // 2
00497       static const int32_t PULSE_WIDTH_mask           = 0x01000000; // 2
00498       static const int32_t OFFSET_TIME_mask           = 0x02000000; // 2
00499       static const int32_t FALL_TIME_mask             = 0x04000000; // 2
00500       static const int32_t RISE_TIME_mask             = 0x08000000; // 2
00501       static const int32_t CIF3_RESERVED_28_mask      = 0x10000000; // N/A (0)
00502       static const int32_t CIF3_RESERVED_29_mask      = 0x20000000; // N/A (0)
00503       static const int32_t TIMESTAMP_SKEW_mask        = 0x40000000; // 2 (See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.3.2)
00504       static const int32_t TIMESTAMP_DETAILS_mask     = 0x80000000; // 2 (See V49.2 spec Section 9.7.3.4)
00505 
00507       static const int32_t CTX_4_OCTETS = AIR_TEMP_mask | SEA_GROUND_TEMP_mask | HUMIDITY_mask | BAROMETRIC_PRESSURE_mask
00508                                         | SEA_AND_SWELL_STATE_mask | TROPOSPHERIC_STATE_mask | NETWORK_ID_mask;
00509       static const int32_t CTX_8_OCTETS = TIMESTAMP_DETAILS_mask | TIMESTAMP_SKEW_mask | RISE_TIME_mask | FALL_TIME_mask
00510                                         | OFFSET_TIME_mask | PULSE_WIDTH_mask | PERIOD_mask | DURATION_mask
00511                                         | DWELL_mask | JITTER_mask;
00513       static const int32_t CTX_TSTAMP_OCTETS = AGE_mask | SHELF_LIFE_mask;
00514 
00515     } END_NAMESPACE // protected_CIF3 namespace
00516 
00517     // CIF4 -- reserved/undefined
00518     // CIF5 -- reserved/undefined
00519     // CIF6 -- reserved/undefined
00520 
00523     namespace protected_CIF7 {
00524 
00526       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_0_mask       = 0x00000001; // N/A (0)
00527       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_1_mask       = 0x00000002; // N/A (0)
00528       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_2_mask       = 0x00000004; // N/A (0)
00529       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_3_mask       = 0x00000008; // N/A (0)
00530       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_4_mask       = 0x00000010; // N/A (0)
00531       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_5_mask       = 0x00000020; // N/A (0)
00532       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_6_mask       = 0x00000040; // N/A (0)
00533       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_7_mask       = 0x00000080; // N/A (0)
00534       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_8_mask       = 0x00000100; // N/A (0)
00535       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_9_mask       = 0x00000200; // N/A (0)
00536       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_10_mask      = 0x00000400; // N/A (0)
00537       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_11_mask      = 0x00000800; // N/A (0)
00538       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_12_mask      = 0x00001000; // N/A (0)
00539       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_13_mask      = 0x00002000; // N/A (0)
00540       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_14_mask      = 0x00004000; // N/A (0)
00541       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_15_mask      = 0x00008000; // N/A (0)
00542       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_16_mask      = 0x00010000; // N/A (0)
00543       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_17_mask      = 0x00020000; // N/A (0)
00544       static const int32_t CIF7_RESERVED_18_mask      = 0x00040000; // N/A (0)
00545       static const int32_t BELIEF_mask                = 0x00080000; // 1 (See V49.2 spec Section 9.12 rules)
00546       static const int32_t PROBABILITY_mask           = 0x00100000; // 1 (See V49.2 spec Section 9.12 rules)
00547       static const int32_t THIRD_DERIVATIVE_mask      = 0x00200000; // same as field it describes
00548       static const int32_t SECOND_DERIVATIVE_mask     = 0x00400000; // same as field it describes
00549       static const int32_t FIRST_DERIVATIVE_mask      = 0x00800000; // same as field it describes
00550       static const int32_t ACCURACY_mask              = 0x01000000; // same as field it describes
00551       static const int32_t PRECISION_mask             = 0x02000000; // same as field it describes
00552       static const int32_t MIN_VALUE_mask             = 0x04000000; // same as field it describes
00553       static const int32_t MAX_VALUE_mask             = 0x08000000; // same as field it describes
00554       static const int32_t STANDARD_DEVIATION_mask    = 0x10000000; // same as field it describes
00555       static const int32_t MEDIAN_VALUE_mask          = 0x20000000; // same as field it describes
00556       static const int32_t AVERAGE_VALUE_mask         = 0x40000000; // same as field it describes
00557       static const int32_t CURRENT_VALUE_mask         = 0x80000000; // same as field it describes
00558 
00560       static const int32_t CTX_4_OCTETS    = PROBABILITY_mask | BELIEF_mask; // These are 4 bytes regardless of field
00562       static const int32_t CTX_SAME_OCTETS = CURRENT_VALUE_mask | AVERAGE_VALUE_mask | MEDIAN_VALUE_mask 
00563                                            | STANDARD_DEVIATION_mask | MAX_VALUE_mask | MIN_VALUE_mask | PRECISION_mask 
00564                                            | ACCURACY_mask | FIRST_DERIVATIVE_mask | SECOND_DERIVATIVE_mask
00565                                            | THIRD_DERIVATIVE_mask;
00566 
00567     } END_NAMESPACE // protected_CIF7 namespace
00568 
00569   } END_NAMESPACE // namespace IndicatorFields

00590   class AbstractGeolocation : public Record {
00594     public: AbstractGeolocation (size_t len);
00595 
00597     public: AbstractGeolocation (const AbstractGeolocation &r);
00598 
00599     public: virtual string toString () const;
00600 
00604     public: inline int32_t getManufacturerIdentifier () const {
00605       return unpackInt(0) & 0x00FFFFFF;
00606     }
00607 
00612     public: inline void setManufacturerIdentifier (int32_t oui) {
00613       if ((oui & 0xFF000000) != 0) throw VRTException("Invalid OUI (%d).", oui);
00614       int32_t val = (unpackByte(0) << 24) | oui;
00615       packInt(0, val);
00616     }
00617 
00621     public: inline string getManufacturerID () const {
00622       return Utilities::toStringOUI(getManufacturerIdentifier());
00623     }
00624 
00629     public: inline void setManufacturerID (const string &oui) {
00630       if (oui.length() == 0) throw VRTException("OUI can not be null");
00631       setManufacturerIdentifier(Utilities::fromStringOUI(oui));
00632     }
00633 
00637     public: TimeStamp getTimeStamp () const;
00638 
00642     protected: virtual void setTimeStamp (const TimeStamp &ts);
00643 
00645     // Implement HasFields
00647     public: virtual int32_t   getFieldCount () const;
00648     public: virtual string    getFieldName  (int32_t id) const;
00649     public: virtual ValueType getFieldType  (int32_t id) const;
00650     public: virtual Value*    getField      (int32_t id) const __attribute__((warn_unused_result));
00651     public: virtual void      setField      (int32_t id, const Value* val);
00652   };

00976   class GeoSentences : public AbstractGeolocation {
00978     public: GeoSentences ();
00979 
00981     public: GeoSentences (const GeoSentences &r);
00982 
00983     public: virtual string toString () const;
00984 
00985     public: inline virtual void writeBytes (const void *buffer) {
00986       // Write Counts
00987       setByteLength(8);
00988       AbstractGeolocation::writeBytes(buffer);
00989 
00990       // Size as appropriate
00991       int32_t numberOfWords = unpackInt(4);
00992       setByteLength(numberOfWords*4 + 8);
00993 
00994       // Write Data
00995       AbstractGeolocation::writeBytes(buffer);
00996     }
00997 
01001     public: inline TimeStamp getTimeStamp () const {
01002       return TimeStamp(); // no time stamp for this class
01003     }
01004 
01008     public: inline string getSentences () const {
01009       return unpackAscii(8, getByteLength()-8);
01010     }
01011 
01015     public: inline void setSentences (string s) {
01016       int32_t numberOfWords = (s.length() + 3) / 4; // round up to nearest word
01017       setByteLength(numberOfWords*4 + 8);
01018       packInt(4, numberOfWords);
01019       packAscii(8, s, numberOfWords*4);
01020     }
01021 
01023     // Implement HasFields
01025     public: virtual int32_t   getFieldCount () const;
01026     public: virtual string    getFieldName  (int32_t id) const;
01027     public: virtual ValueType getFieldType  (int32_t id) const;
01028     public: virtual Value*    getField      (int32_t id) const __attribute__((warn_unused_result));
01029     public: virtual void      setField      (int32_t id, const Value* val);
01030   };

01033   class ContextAssocLists : public Record {
01035     public: ContextAssocLists ();
01036 
01038     public: ContextAssocLists (const ContextAssocLists &r);
01039 
01040     public: virtual string toString () const;
01041 
01042     public: inline virtual void writeBytes (const void *buffer) {
01043       // Write Counts
01044       setByteLength(8);
01045       Record::writeBytes(buffer);
01046 
01047       // Size as appropriate
01048       updateByteLength(-1);
01049 
01050       // Write Data
01051       Record::writeBytes(buffer);
01052     }
01053 
01055     private: void updateByteLength (int32_t off);
01056 
01058     public: inline int32_t getSourceContextCount () const { return unpackShort(0) & 0x01FF; }
01060     public: inline int32_t getSystemContextCount () const { return unpackShort(2) & 0x01FF; }
01062     public: inline int32_t getVectorComponentCount () const { return unpackShort(4) & 0xFFFF; }
01064     public: inline int32_t getAsynchronousChannelCount () const { return unpackShort(6) & 0x7FFF; }
01066     public: inline bool getAsynchronousChannelTagsPresent () const { return (unpackShort(6) & 0x8000) != 0; }
01067 
01068     private: inline int32_t getSourceContextOffset ()           const { return 8; }
01069     private: inline int32_t getSystemContextOffset ()           const { return getSourceContextOffset()       + 4*getSourceContextCount(); }
01070     private: inline int32_t getVectorComponentOffset ()         const { return getSystemContextOffset()       + 4*getSystemContextCount(); }
01071     private: inline int32_t getAsynchronousChannelOffset ()     const { return getVectorComponentOffset()     + 4*getVectorComponentCount(); }
01072     private: inline int32_t getAsynchronousChannelTagsOffset () const { return getAsynchronousChannelOffset() + 4*getAsynchronousChannelCount(); }
01073 
01075     private: void resize (int32_t pos, int32_t max, int32_t off, int32_t old, int32_t val);
01076 
01078     public: inline void setSourceContextCount (int32_t val) {
01079       resize(0, 0x1FF, getSourceContextOffset(), getSourceContextCount(), val);
01080     }
01081 
01083     public: inline void setSystemContextCount (int32_t val) {
01084       resize(2, 0x1FF, getSystemContextOffset(), getSystemContextCount(), val);
01085     }
01086 
01088     public: inline void setVectorComponentCount (int32_t val) {
01089       resize(4, 0xFFFF, getVectorComponentOffset(), getVectorComponentCount(), val);
01090     }
01091 
01093     public: inline void setAsynchronousChannelCount (int32_t val) {
01094       resize(6, 0x7FFF, getAsynchronousChannelOffset(), getAsynchronousChannelCount(), val);
01095       if (getAsynchronousChannelTagsPresent()) {
01096         resize(6, 0x7FFF, getAsynchronousChannelTagsOffset(), getAsynchronousChannelCount(), val);
01097       }
01098     }
01099 
01101     public: void setAsynchronousChannelTagsPresent (bool val);
01102 
01106     public: vector<int32_t> getSourceContext () const;
01107 
01111     public: vector<int32_t> getSystemContext () const;
01112 
01116     public: vector<int32_t> getVectorComponent () const;
01117 
01122     public: vector<int32_t> getAsynchronousChannel () const;
01123 
01130     public: vector<int32_t> getAsynchronousChannelTag () const;
01131 
01135     public: void setSourceContext (const vector<int32_t> &val);
01136 
01140     public: void setSystemContext (const vector<int32_t> &val);
01141 
01145     public: void setVectorComponent (const vector<int32_t> &val);
01146 
01151     public: void setAsynchronousChannel (const vector<int32_t> &val);
01152 
01161     public: void setAsynchronousChannel (const vector<int32_t> &val, const vector<int32_t> &tags);
01162 
01164     // Implement HasFields
01166     public: virtual int32_t   getFieldCount () const;
01167     public: virtual string    getFieldName  (int32_t id) const;
01168     public: virtual ValueType getFieldType  (int32_t id) const;
01169     public: virtual Value*    getField      (int32_t id) const __attribute__((warn_unused_result));
01170     public: virtual void      setField      (int32_t id, const Value* val);
01171   };

01201     public: inline int32_t getTotalFieldSize () const { return unpackInt(0); }
01202

01230     // Implement HasFields
01232     public: virtual int32_t   getFieldCount () const;
01233     public: virtual string    getFieldName  (int32_t id) const;
01234     public: virtual ValueType getFieldType  (int32_t id) const;
01235     public: virtual Value*    getField      (int32_t id) const __attribute__((warn_unused_result));
01236     public: virtual void      setField      (int32_t id, const Value* val);
01237   };

01240   class ArrayOfRecords : public Record {
01242     public: ArrayOfRecords ();
01243 
01245     public: ArrayOfRecords (const ArrayOfRecords &r);
01246 
01247     public: virtual string toString () const;
01248 
01249     public: inline virtual void writeBytes (const void *buffer) {
01250       // Write Counts
01251       setByteLength(12);
01252       Record::writeBytes(buffer);
01253 
01254       // Size as appropriate
01255       updateByteLength();
01256 
01257       // Write Data
01258       Record::writeBytes(buffer);
01259     }
01260 
01262     private: void updateByteLength (int32_t off=-1);
01263 
01265     public: inline int32_t getTotalFieldSize () const { return unpackInt(0); }
01266 
01268     public: inline int32_t getHeaderSize () const { return ((int32_t) unpackByte(4)) & 0xFF; }
01269 
01271     public: inline int32_t getRecordSize () const { return (unpackInt(4)>>12) & 0xFFF; }
01272 
01274     public: void setRecordSize (int32_t val);
01275 
01277     public: inline int32_t getRecordCount () const { return unpackInt(4) & 0xFFF; }
01278 
01280     public: void setRecordCount (int32_t val, int32_t off=-1);
01281 
01283     public: inline int32_t getBitMappedIndicator () const { return unpackInt(8); }
01284 
01286     public: inline void setBitMappedIndicator (int32_t val) { packInt(8, val); }
01287 
01288     
01292     public: inline vector<char> getApplicationSpecificHeader () const { return unpackBytes(12, getHeaderSize()*4); }
01293 
01298     public: void setApplicationSpecificHeader (const vector<char> &val);
01299 
01308     public: void setApplicationSpecificHeader (const char* val, size_t bytes);
01309 
01314     private: inline int32_t getRecordEntriesByteOffset () const { return 12+4*getHeaderSize(); }
01315 
01323     public: vector<Record> getRecords (int32_t idx=0, int32_t num=-1) const;
01324 
01331     public: void getRecord (int32_t idx, Record &rec) const;
01332 
01336     public: void setRecords (const vector<Record> &val);
01337 
01347     public: int32_t addRecords (const vector<Record> &val, int32_t idx=-1);
01348 
01354     public: bool addRecord (const Record &val, int32_t idx=-1);

01363     public: virtual Value*    getField      (int32_t id) const __attribute__((warn_unused_result));

01368   class SpectrumField : public Record {
01370     public: SpectrumField ();
01371 
01373     public: SpectrumField (const SpectrumField &r);
01374 
01375     public: virtual string toString () const;
01376 
01378     public: virtual int8_t getSpectrumType () const { return unpackByte(3); }
01379     public: virtual void setSpectrumType (int8_t val) { packByte(3, val); }
01380 
01382     public: virtual int8_t getAveragingType () const { return unpackByte(2); }
01383     public: virtual void setAveragingType (int8_t val) { packByte(2, val); }
01384 
01386     public: virtual int8_t getWindowTime () const { return (unpackByte(1) & 0xF); }
01387     public: virtual void setWindowTime (int8_t val) { packByte(1, val & 0xF); }
01388 
01389     //reserved: word 0, bits 31..20
01390 
01392     public: virtual int8_t getWindowType () const { return unpackByte(7); }
01393     public: virtual void setWindowType (int8_t val) { packByte(7, val); }
01394 
01395     // reserved: word 1, bits 31..8
01396 
01397     // NumTransformPoints: word 2, bits 31..0
01398     public: virtual int32_t getNumTransformPoints () const { return unpackInt(8); }
01399     public: virtual void setNumTransformPoints (int32_t val) { packInt(8, val); }
01400 
01402     public: virtual int32_t getNumWindowPoints () const { return unpackInt(12); }
01403     public: virtual void setNumWindowPoints (int32_t val) { packInt(12, val); }
01404 
01408     public: virtual double getResolution () const {
01409       int64_t bits = unpackLong(16);
01410       return (isNull(bits))? DOUBLE_NAN : VRTMath::toDouble64(20,bits);
01411     }
01412     public: virtual void setResolution (double val) {
01413       int64_t bits = (isNull(val))? INT64_NULL : VRTMath::fromDouble64(20,val);
01414       packLong(16, bits);
01415     }
01416 
01420     public: virtual double getSpan () const {
01421       int64_t bits = unpackLong(24);
01422       return (isNull(bits))? DOUBLE_NAN : VRTMath::toDouble64(20,bits);
01423     }
01424     public: virtual void setSpan (double val) {
01425       int64_t bits = (isNull(val))? INT64_NULL : VRTMath::fromDouble64(20,val);
01426       packLong(24, bits);
01427     }
01428 
01430     public: virtual int32_t getNumAverages () const { return unpackInt(32); }
01431     public: virtual void setNumAverages (int32_t val) { packInt(32, val); }
01432 
01434     public: virtual int32_t getWeightingFactor () const { return unpackInt(36); }
01435     public: virtual void setWeightingFactor (int32_t val) { packInt(36, val); }
01436 
01438     public: virtual int32_t getSpectrumF1Index () const { return unpackInt(40); }
01439     public: virtual void setSpectrumF1Index (int32_t val) { packInt(40, val); }
01440 
01442     public: virtual int32_t getSpectrumF2Index () const { return unpackInt(44); }
01443     public: virtual void setSpectrumF2Index (int32_t val) { packInt(44, val); }
01444 
01448     public: virtual int32_t getWindowTimeDeltaInt () const { return unpackInt(48); }
01449     public: virtual void setWindowTimeDeltaInt (int32_t val) { packInt(48, val); }
01450 
01454     public: virtual double getWindowTimeDeltaFloat () const {
01455       int32_t bits = unpackInt(52);
01456       return (bits == 0x7FFFFFFF)? DOUBLE_NAN : VRTMath::toDouble32(12, bits);
01457     }
01458     public: virtual void setWindowTimeDeltaFloat (double val) {
01459       int32_t bits = (isNull(val))? 0x7FFFFFFF : VRTMath::fromDouble32(12, val);
01460       packInt(52, bits);
01461     }
01462 
01464     // Implement HasFields
01466     public: virtual int32_t   getFieldCount () const;

01469     public: virtual Value*    getField      (int32_t id) const __attribute__((warn_unused_result));

01476   class IndicatorFieldProvider {
01477     
01478     public: virtual ~IndicatorFieldProvider () { }
01479 
01480     /**********************************************************/
01481     /* Functions from BasicContextPacket that are CIF related */
01482     /**********************************************************/
01483 
01493     protected: virtual int32_t getOffset (int8_t cifNum, int32_t field) const = 0;
01494     protected: virtual int32_t getOffset (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field) const {
01495       return getOffset(getCIFNumber(field), getCIFBitMask(field));
01496     }
01497     // Used for getting attribute of a field, based on CIF7 attributes
01498     // A negative return value means attribute not present.
01499     // A NULL return value means the entire CIF is not present.
01500     // @return offset to attribute of specified field
01501     // @throws VRTException when field has invalid length (size)
01502     // @throws VRTException when field is not present (TODO - or return NULL?)
01503     protected: virtual int32_t getOffset (int8_t cifNum, int32_t field, int32_t cif7) const {
01504       int32_t fieldOffset = getOffset(cifNum, field);
01505       if (fieldOffset < 0) throw VRTException("Cannot get attribute of a field that is not present.");
01506       int32_t fieldLen = getFieldLen(cifNum, field);
01507       if (fieldLen <= 0) throw VRTException("Cannot get attribute of a field with invalid length.");
01508       int32_t cif7Offset = getCif7Offset(cif7, fieldLen);
01509       if (cif7Offset < 0) fieldOffset = -fieldOffset;
01510       return fieldOffset + cif7Offset;
01511     }
01512     // XXX this may cause ambiguity since both args are ints, same as first getOffset defined above
01513     protected: virtual int32_t getOffset (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7) const {
01514       return getOffset(getCIFNumber(field), getCIFBitMask(field), getCIFBitMask(cif7));
01515     }
01516     // Used for getting second occurrence of CIFs (i.e. Ack packets have second occurrence for errors (first is for warnings)
01517     protected: virtual int32_t getOffset (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, bool occurrence) const {
01518       return getOffset(getCIFNumber(field) | (((int8_t)occurrence)<<3), getCIFBitMask(field));
01519     }
01520     // Combo of cif7 attributes and second occurrence
01521     // XXX - if this is only ever used with occurrence=true, replace with new function name that does it without occurrence arg
01522     protected: virtual int32_t getOffset (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, IndicatorFieldEnum_t cif7, bool occurrence) const {
01523       return getOffset(getCIFNumber(field) | (((int8_t)occurrence)<<3), getCIFBitMask(field), getCIFBitMask(cif7));
01524     }
01525 
01533     protected: virtual int32_t getCif7Offset (int32_t attr, int32_t len) const {
01534       UNUSED_VARIABLE(attr);
01535       UNUSED_VARIABLE(len);
01536       // Default impl throws exception for classes that don't support CIF7
01537       throw VRTException("Class does not support CIF7.");
01538     }
01539 
01541     // TODO - CIF7 implications on below?
01542     protected: virtual int32_t getFieldLen (int8_t cifNum, int32_t field) const = 0;
01543     protected: virtual int32_t getFieldLen (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field) const {
01544       return getFieldLen(getCIFNumber(field), getCIFBitMask(field));
01545     }
01546

01549     protected: virtual int8_t getB (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, int32_t xoff) const {
01550       return getB(getCIFNumber(field), getCIFBitMask(field), xoff);
01551     }

01673     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField (int8_t cifNum) const {
01674       switch(cifNum&0xF7) { // Ignore bit 3 (occurrence)
01675         case 0: return getContextIndicatorField0(cifNum&0x08);
01676         case 1: return getContextIndicatorField1(cifNum&0x08);
01677         case 2: return getContextIndicatorField2(cifNum&0x08);
01678         case 3: return getContextIndicatorField3(cifNum&0x08);
01679         case 7: return getContextIndicatorField7(cifNum&0x08);
01680         default:
01681           throw VRTException("Invalid Context Indicator Field number.");
01682       }
01683     }
01684 
01685     // May return NULL
01686     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, bool occurrence=0) const {
01687       return getContextIndicatorField(getCIFNumber(field) | (((int8_t)occurrence)<<3));
01688     }
01689 
01690     // These may return NULL
01691     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField0 (bool occurrence=0) const = 0;
01692     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField1 (bool occurrence=0) const = 0;
01693     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField2 (bool occurrence=0) const = 0;
01694     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField3 (bool occurrence=0) const = 0;
01695     protected: virtual int32_t getContextIndicatorField7 (bool occurrence=0) const = 0;
01696 
01702     // XXX Generic CIF bit getter XXX
01703     protected: virtual boolNull getContextIndicatorFieldBit (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, bool occurrence=0) const {
01704       return getContextIndicatorFieldBit(getCIFNumber(field) | (((int8_t)occurrence)<<3), getCIFBitMask(field));
01705     }
01706     protected: virtual boolNull getContextIndicatorFieldBit (int8_t cifNum, int32_t bit) const {
01707       int32_t cif = getContextIndicatorField(cifNum);
01708       if (isNull(cif)) return _NULL;
01709       return ((cif & bit) != 0) ? _TRUE : _FALSE;
01710     }
01711 
01716     protected: virtual void setContextIndicatorFieldBit (IndicatorFieldEnum_t field, bool set, bool occurrence=0) {
01717       setContextIndicatorFieldBit(getCIFNumber(field) | (((int8_t)occurrence)<<3), getCIFBitMask(field), set);
01718     }
01719     protected: virtual void setContextIndicatorFieldBit (int8_t cifNum, int32_t bit, bool set) {
01720       switch(cifNum&0xF7) { // Ignore bit 3 (occurrence)
01721         case 0: return setContextIndicatorField0Bit(bit, set, cifNum&0x08);
01722         case 1: return setContextIndicatorField1Bit(bit, set, cifNum&0x08);
01723         case 2: return setContextIndicatorField2Bit(bit, set, cifNum&0x08);
01724         case 3: return setContextIndicatorField3Bit(bit, set, cifNum&0x08);
01725         case 7: return setContextIndicatorField7Bit(bit, set, cifNum&0x08);
01726         default:
01727           throw VRTException("Invalid Context Indicator Field number.");
01728       }
01729     }
01730     protected: virtual void setContextIndicatorField0Bit (int32_t bit, bool set, bool occurrence=0) = 0;
01731     protected: virtual void setContextIndicatorField1Bit (int32_t bit, bool set, bool occurrence=0) = 0;
01732     protected: virtual void setContextIndicatorField2Bit (int32_t bit, bool set, bool occurrence=0) = 0;
01733     protected: virtual void setContextIndicatorField3Bit (int32_t bit, bool set, bool occurrence=0) = 0;
01734     protected: virtual void setContextIndicatorField7Bit (int32_t bit, bool set, bool occurrence=0) = 0;

02457     public: inline void setDeviceIdentifier (int64_t val) {
02458       if (!isNull(val) && ((val & ~__INT64_C(0x00FFFFFF0000FFFF)) != 0)) {
02459         throw VRTException("Invalid device identifier");
02460       }
02461       setX(DEVICE_ID,val);
02462     }

02790     // XXX SNR and Noise Figure share a 32-bit word. Setting either to null will set both to null.

02792     //     and 2nd,3rd order intercept points
02793

03057     public: inline double getRange () const {
03058       int32_t bits = getL(RANGE);
03059       // XXX if bits==INT32_NULL, could be valid value or could be indicating Range is not set
03060       if (isNull(bits) && getOffset(RANGE) < 0) return DOUBLE_NAN;
03061       return (bits == 0x7FFFFFFF)? DOUBLE_NAN : toDouble32(6, bits);
03062     }
03063 
03068     public: inline void setRange (double val) {
03069       int32_t bits = (isNull(val))? 0x7FFFFFFF : fromDouble32(6, val);
03070       setL(RANGE,bits);
03071     }

03175     public: inline float get2DPointingAngleAzimuth () const {
03176       int16_t bits = getI(PNT_ANGL_2D_SI,2);
03177       if (isNull(bits)) return FLOAT_NAN;
03178       float val = VRTMath::toFloat16(7,bits);
03179       return (val < 0)? 512.0+val : val;
03180     }

03192     public: inline void set2DPointingAngleElevation (float val) {

03194         setL(PNT_ANGL_2D_SI, INT32_NULL);
03195       } else {

03197         setI(PNT_ANGL_2D_SI,0,bits);
03198       }
03199     }
03200 
03211     public: inline void set2DPointingAngleAzimuth (float val) {
03212       if (isNull(val)) {
03213         setL(PNT_ANGL_2D_SI, INT32_NULL);
03214       } else {
03215         if (val > 255.984375) val = val-512;
03216         int16_t bits = VRTMath::fromFloat16(7,val);
03217         setI(PNT_ANGL_2D_SI,2,bits);
03218       }
03219     }

04161     public: inline int16_t getSeaAndSwellState () const {
04162       int16_t bits = getI(SEA_AND_SWELL_STATE, 2);
04163       return (isNull(bits))? INT16_NULL : bits;
04164     }
04165 
04180     public: inline void setSeaAndSwellState (int16_t val) {
04181       if (!isNull(val)) {
04182         int8_t sea = val&0x1F;
04183         int8_t swell = (val>>5)&0x1F;
04184         if (sea < 0 || swell < 0 || sea > 9 || swell > 9)
04185           throw VRTException("Sea and Swell must both be between 0 and 9.");
04186       }
04187       setI(SEA_AND_SWELL_STATE, 2, val);
04188     }
04189 
04190     // XXX could add set/getSeaState, set/getSwellState, set/getSeaAndSwellStateUserDefinedBits
04191 
04207     public: inline void setSeaAndSwellState (int8_t sea, int8_t swell) {
04208       if (isNull(sea) || isNull(swell))
04209         throw VRTException("Sea and Swell must both not be null to use this method.");
04210       if (sea < 0 || swell < 0 || sea > 9 || swell > 9)
04211         throw VRTException("Sea and Swell must both be between 0 and 9.");
04212       int16_t val = (swell<<5) | sea;
04213       setI(SEA_AND_SWELL_STATE, 2, val);
04214     }

04684     // BELIEF_mask                = 0x00080000; // 1 (See V49.2 spec Section 9.12 rules)
04685     // PROBABILITY_mask           = 0x00100000; // 1 (See V49.2 spec Section 9.12 rules)
04686     // THIRD_DERIVATIVE_mask      = 0x00200000; // same as field it describes
04687     // SECOND_DERIVATIVE_mask     = 0x00400000; // same as field it describes
04688     // FIRST_DERIVATIVE_mask      = 0x00800000; // same as field it describes
04689     // ACCURACY_mask              = 0x01000000; // same as field it describes
04690     // PRECISION_mask             = 0x02000000; // same as field it describes
04691     // MIN_VALUE_mask             = 0x04000000; // same as field it describes
04692     // MAX_VALUE_mask             = 0x08000000; // same as field it describes
04693     // STANDARD_DEVIATION_mask    = 0x10000000; // same as field it describes
04694     // MEDIAN_VALUE_mask          = 0x20000000; // same as field it describes
04695     // AVERAGE_VALUE_mask         = 0x40000000; // same as field it describes
04696     // CURRENT_VALUE_mask         = 0x80000000; // same as field it describes
04697     /* XXX END OF CIF7 FUNCTIONS XXX */
